intro: Rudgea stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Rudgea stenantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
